title: Turkey Cuts Rates Further to Kick Start Its Sluggish Economy
text:
ISTANBUL—Turkey’s central bank cut its benchmark rate for the third time in four months, as its new governor continued to ease policy in line with President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s attempt to stimulate economic growth.

The central bank on Thursday cut its key rate to 14% from 16.5%. The cut comes after President Trump said he would lift U.S. sanctions against Turkey after its forces suspended their offensive against Kurdish forces in northern Syria, a decision that could provide relief to investors and businesses concerned...
description: Turkey’s central bank cut its benchmark rate for the third time in four months, as its new governor continued to ease policy in line with President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s attempt to stimulate the recession-hit economy.
